form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Hatch introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works

form.official-title: To amend title 23, United States Code, to reform the surface transportation project delivery program.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Surface Transportation Project Delivery Program Improvement Act.

section.header: Surface transportation project delivery program improvement

subsection.text: Section 327(c) of title 23, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: in paragraph (3)(A), by inserting , and is solely responsible and liable for carrying out those responsibilities after subsection (a); and
in paragraph (4), by inserting reasonably before considers necessary.

subsection.text: Section 327(e) of title 23, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: by inserting and without further approval of after in lieu of; and
by inserting (including the defense of any civil action under subsection (d)) after assumed under subsection (a)(2).

subsection.text: Section 327(g) of title 23, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: in paragraph (1), by striking shall conduct and all that follows through the end of subparagraph (B) and inserting the following: “shall—

subparagraph.text: not later than 180 days after the date of execution of an assignment agreement under this section, meet with the State to review implementation of the assignment agreement and discuss plans for the first annual audit;
conduct annual audits during each of the first 4 years of State participation; and
ensure that the time period for completing an annual audit, from initiation to completion (including public comment and responses to those comments), does not exceed 180 days.

paragraph.text: by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.text: An audit conducted under paragraph (1) shall be carried out by an audit team determined by the Secretary, in consultation with the State, in accordance with subparagraph (B).
Consultation with the State under subparagraph (A) shall include a reasonable opportunity for the State to review and provide comments on the proposed members of the audit team.

clause.text: On request by the State, the audit team shall include not less than 1 member designated by the State, in consultation with the Secretary.
A member designated by the State under clause (i) may be any person with relevant expertise and experience who is not an employee of the Secretary or of the State.

subsection.text: Section 327 of title 23, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following:
The Secretary, in cooperation with the American Association of State Highway and Transportation Officials, shall carry out education, training, peer exchange, and other initiatives, as appropriate—

paragraph.text: to assist States in developing the capacity to participate in the assignment program under this section; and
to promote information sharing and collaboration among States that are participating in the program.
